faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: This subject gives an overview of the theoretical basis of health promotion; of principles of health promotion in different target groups and on different levels; of the fields of mental health, health and risk behaviours, of the theoretical basis and possibilities for implementation of health promotion interventions. Medical students get knowledge on health promotion activities and main current health problems in Estonia. The framework of this subject is based on possible arising health problems in daily work of physicians.
description.et: Aine annab ülevaate tervisedenduse teoreetilistest alustest, tervisedenduse põhimõtetest erinevates sihtrühmades ja erinevatel tasanditel; vaimse tervise, tervis- ja riskikäitumise valdkondadest, sekkumistegevuste teoreetilistest lähtekohtadest ja praktilistest rakendamisvõimalustest. Üliõpilased omandavad teadmised peamistest  tervisedenduslikest tegevustest Eestis ning valdkonna aktuaalsetest probleemidest käesoleval ajal. Aine õpetamisel lähtutakse tulevase arstitööga seotud võimalikest esilekerkivatest probleemidest tervisedenduse valdkonnas ning tutvustatakse erinevaid sekkumisvõimalusi.

objectives.en: - to give basic knowledge in general terms, principles and conceptions of health promotion;
objectives.et: - anda alusteadmised tervisedenduse olemusest, selle põhimõistetest ja kontseptsioonidest;

objectives.en: - to give an overview of  the Estonian National Health Plan and to describe the place of health promotion in health system;
objectives.et: - anda ülevaade Eesti rahvastiku tervise arengukavast ja tervisedenduse kohast tervishoiusüsteemis;

objectives.en: -  to give an overview of mental health, health and risk behaviours, and possibilities of health promotion in different target groups;
objectives.et: - anda ülevaade vaimse tervise, tervis- ja riskikäitumise olulisematest valdkondadest ja tervise edendamise võimalustest erinevates sihtrühmades;

objectives.en: - to give a knowledge in theoretical basis of health promotion interventions and to introduce possibilities for implementation on different levels;
objectives.et: - õpetada tervisedenduslike sekkumistegevuste teoreetilisi lähtekohti ja praktilisi rakendamisvõimalusi erinevatel tasanditel.

learning_outcomes.en: - is familiar with main principles of health promotion;
- has an overview of the Estonian National Health Plan;
learning_outcomes.et: - omab ülevaadet Eesti rahvastiku tervise arengukavast;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows main fields of health and risk behaviours and is able to interpret research results of different fields;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab erinevaid tervis- ja riskikäitumise valdkondi ning suudab tõlgendada valdkondade uuringutulemusi

learning_outcomes.en: - knows possibilities of health promotion interventions in different target groups and on different levels and is able to use theoretical knowledge in preparation of intervention programs;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb sekkumisvõimalusi tervise- ja riskikäitumise olulisemates valdkondades erinevatel tasanditel ja erinevates sihtrühmades ning oskab kasutada tervisedenduse teoreetilisi teadmisi sekkumisprogrammi koostamisel;

independent_work.et: Instructions for oral presentations and health promotion projects are available in Moodle.

description.et: Oral presentation, which is 10% of the final grade of the subject.
Written test, which is 70% of the final grade of the subject.
Health promotion project, which is 20% of the final grade of the subject.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in at least 75% of seminars. Successfully (positive grade - >50%) done oral presentation and health promotion project.

grade_evaluation.et: A final grade may be obtained throughout the course (see information in Moodle) or by way of a final evaluation Final grade is based on the results of examination test (70%), oral presentation (10%) and health promotion project (20%).

debt_elimination.et: Beginning from the third missed seminar it is compulsory to write an essay (about 1500 words) on the topic of the missed seminar.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Materials of lectures and seminars. Additional list of obligatory reading materials is organized by teaching staff of different lectures, seminars/topics and is available in the Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials: List of recommended reading materials is organized by teaching staff   and is available in the Moodle.

description.et: Introduction. Health, health determinants, health promotion (video lecture). Kersti Pärna
Global health concept, influences and trends. Terje Peetso
Mental health of the Estonian population. Merike Sisask
Social determinants of health and health inequities. Ave Põld
Development of health promotion in Estonia: planning and financing. Sirje Vaask
Tobacco use. Nicotine dependence. Mariliis Põld
Diseases prevention and public health. Margus Viigimaa
Is healthy ageing possible? Tiina Tambaum
Physical activity and health. Jarek Mäestu
Determinants of sexual and reproductive health. Kai Part
Drugs: biological, psychological, social and cultural construction. Jaanus Harro
Presentation of the best HP project. Examples of the health promotion projects.  Inga Villa/Kersti Pärna
